text: My favorite thing about the film is how the twins instantly became a part of each other's families & now they're all one big global family.
author: sarahgranger

text: It's a sweet film. Glad they made it. And you should all watch! I told my family about it too. Still trying to teach my mom how to access @netflix - maybe my uncle can figure it out & they can all watch together.
author: sarahgranger

text: A thing identical twin stories don't tend to share: what happens to extended families. My aunt is truly a 2nd mom & my cousins are genetically my half-sisters. We grew up like any cousins, but as adults, they're more like siblings. In @23andMe my cousin is listed as a sister.
author: sarahgranger

text: Just watched @twinstersmovie on @netflix. Highly recommended. My mother & aunt are identical twins & I cannot imagine their lives without each other. Thank you @samfuterman & @AnaisFBordier for sharing your story with the world.

text: Here's the context from my reporting in June:
author: sarahgranger

text: The women at Marvel knew what they were up against with the lack of female critics for films. At last summer's Crystal + Lucy Awards, @brielarson spoke out at length about the problem. They faced it head-on and so far, it's worked in their favor.
author: sarahgranger

text: I saw @captainmarvel Saturday night & loved it. I was happily surprised to see the @LAWeekly cameo since I interviewed @brielarson & Victoria Alonso, EVP of @MarvelStudios for LA Weekly last year. Alonso told me she thought my daughter would enjoy #CaptainMarvel. She was right!
author: sarahgranger

text: As someone who came from the startup world, I see this as an opportunity. People have stories to tell. Seems like an intermediary could help them. Maybe a group of co-writers who have reps who choose one-time scripts to rewrite & pitch. Plenty of vehicles like this in publishing.
